title: Designing a Systematic Mathematical Modeling Workshop for Organizational Vision Development: A Long-Term Course for Experts

context.prior_knowledge: Organizational management and foundational mathematical modeling skills (differential equations, matrix operations), as well as data analysis experience (statistical inference, data visualization)
context.additional_context: A course for math experts in medical, legal, and technical fields to strengthen organizational decision-making competencies. Conducting asynchronous learning and group collaboration in a BYOD environment, learners focus on solving complex organizational problems using advanced mathematical techniques (graph theory, simulations, probabilistic modeling).

learning_goals: Learners can analyze core elements of an organizational vision framework (core values, future vision, strategic emphases) using linear/nonlinear equations and optimization techniques.
Using online collaboration tools, learners draft a shared vision per team and iteratively refine it through feedback to probabilistically predict over 80% participant satisfaction.

Through project-based assessment, learners develop a vision implementation roadmap applying real corporate cases and meet both quantitative (regression analysis, A/B testing) and qualitative evaluation criteria.

resources: AI grading system for feedback loops

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
